Data Preprocessing Pipeline

Source: R/preprocess_data.R
preprocess_data.Rd

Comprehensive data preprocessing workflow for Nedap/FIRE sensor data with format conversion, data validation, and quality control checks.

preprocess_data(
  data,
  station_type = "nedap",
  print_details = FALSE,
  quiet = FALSE
)

Arguments

data

[data.frame/data.table] Input dataset

  • Must contain specific columns depending on station_type

  • Accepts both data.frame and data.table objects

  • Automatically converts to data.table internally

station_type

[character] Data source specification

  • "nedap": Requires Nedap-specific columns

    • Required columns: animal_number, lifenumber, responder, location, visit_time, duration, state, weight, feed_intake

  • "fire": Requires FIRE system columns

    • Required columns: Location, Tag, Date, Entry, Exit, Ent Wt, Ext Wt, Consumed, Weight, Topup Amount

  • Default: "nedap"

print_details

[logical] Debugging output control

  • TRUE: Show detailed duplicate responder information

  • FALSE: Suppress detailed output (default)

quiet

Comprehensive silencing control

  • Purpose: Suppresses all non-essential output

  • Default: FALSE

  • Effect:

    • Disables progress messages

    • Suppresses warnings

    • Overrides print_details

Value

[data.table] Processed dataset with enhanced structure:

  • Standardized column names and data types

  • Added temporal sequences: - seq_days: Daily sequence counter - seq_in_day: Intra-day visit order - seq_in_location: Location-specific sequence

  • Optimized key-based indexing for: - responder, date, visit_time

Details

Core Processing Workflow

  1. Input Validation

    • Check dataset existence and format

    • Verify required column presence

    • Auto-conversion to data.table

  2. Format Standardization

    • Convert FIRE data to Nedap format (when station_type = "fire")

    • Standardize column names and units

    • Handle datetime conversions

  3. Data Cleaning

    • Remove invalid records (NA responders, zero tags)

    • Deduplicate records

    • Resolve cross-location responder conflicts

  4. Feature Engineering

    • Generate sequence numbers (daily/location-based)

    • Create time-based indexes

    • Add derived metrics

Note

Key Constraints:

  • Critical columns must exist based on station_type

  • FIRE data conversion includes: - Unit conversions (kg to g) - DateTime standardization (UTC timezone) - Removal of invalid Tag == "0" records

  • Duplicate responder resolution selects location with most records

See also

  • data.table::data.table For underlying data manipulation

Examples

result_nedap <- preprocess_data(data = mintyr::nedap, station_type = "nedap", quiet = TRUE)
head(result_nedap)
#> Key: <responder, date, visit_time>
#>    animal_number lifenumber responder location          visit_time duration
#>            <int>     <lgcl>    <char>   <char>              <POSc>    <int>
#> 1:      10113913         NA     13913      101 2024-02-19 22:21:41       75
#> 2:      10113913         NA     13913      101 2024-02-20 01:00:02      288
#> 3:      10113913         NA     13913      101 2024-02-20 01:05:04        4
#> 4:      10113913         NA     13913      101 2024-02-20 02:53:50      434
#> 5:      10113913         NA     13913      101 2024-02-20 04:27:26      228
#> 6:      10113913         NA     13913      101 2024-02-20 06:51:37        6
#>    state weight feed_intake       date     n seq_days seq_in_day
#>    <int>  <int>       <int>     <Date> <int>    <int>      <int>
#> 1:     0  23500           1 2024-02-19  1376        1          1
#> 2:     0  23500          39 2024-02-20  1376        2          1
#> 3:     0  31000           0 2024-02-20  1376        2          2
#> 4:     0  23500          64 2024-02-20  1376        2          3

#> 2:               1
#> 3:               2
#> 4:               3
#> 5:               4
#> 6:               5
